request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Protected Health Information
Email submission of authorization form (facility-specific ROI email addresses)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: MUSC offers three pathways — MyChart portal for patient self-access, Ciox/Swellbox online eRequest wizard, and a downloadable generic HIPAA authorization form for manual submission via fax, email, or mail.

red_flags: Witness signature line included with warning that incomplete forms may be invalidated — not required by HIPAA
Fee language references only South Carolina state law, not HIPAA's more restrictive cost-based fee limits for patient access
MyChart instructions state blanket fees for all patient requests with prepayment required before records release, no amounts disclosed
Encrypted/unencrypted email confusion — checkbox says 'Encrypted E-mail' but consent text warns about 'unencrypted e-mail' risks
bright_spots: Spanish-language form available as a faithful, current-revision translation co-located with the English version
Three distinct request pathways (MyChart, Ciox/Swellbox portal, manual form) clearly presented on medical records page
Comprehensive facility directory with contact information for 9 MUSC Health locations across South Carolina
Dedicated SUD records section with granular opt-in and proper 42 CFR Part 2 regulatory citation
Explicit citation of 45 CFR §164.524 (patient right of access)
Process-level differentiation between patient self-access (MyChart/portal) and third-party release (authorization form)

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available — medical records page reachable in 2 clicks from homepage with three clearly labeled pathways; web searches return direct PDF links; no access barriers encountered.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the Ciox/Swellbox portal provides a fully digital request workflow, but the primary PDF form has zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite; fax and email submission available for the paper form.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — logical flow, granular record type options, appropriate 2-page length, but encrypted/unencrypted email language creates confusion and legal consent text is dense.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but the primary downloadable form wasn't designed for them — it's a generic HIPAA authorization with 'Patient Request' as one checkbox among seven purposes; the org differentiates at the process level (MyChart for self-access, auth form for third-party) but not within the form itself.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements beyond what HIPAA requires — witness signature line not required by HIPAA, fee language references only SC state law without acknowledging HIPAA's cost-based fee limits for patient access, prepayment requirement in MyChart instructions; offset by proper revocation language, voluntariness statement, and 45 CFR §164.524 citation.

overall.summary: MUSC Health offers excellent findability and multiple request pathways including a digital portal, but its core authorization form is a generic third-party release document that doesn't center patient self-access, with compliance concerns around the witness requirement and fee disclosure.
